Sentencas: Reference electrodes are frequently applied to isolate the performance of one electrode in a solid oxide fuel cell.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: However, reference electrode simulations raise doubt to the veracity of data collected using reference electrodes.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: The simulations predict that the reported performance for the one electrode will frequently contain performance of both electrodes.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: Nonetheless, recent reports persistently treat data so collected as ideally isolated.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: This work confirms the predictions of the reference electrode simulations on two SOFC designs, and provides a method of validating the data measured in the 3-electrode configuration.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: Validation is based on the assumption that a change in gas composition to one electrode does not affect the impedance of the other electrode at open circuit voltage.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: This assumption is supported by a full physics simulation of the SOFC.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: Three configurations of reference electrode and cell design are experimentally examined using various gas flows and two temperatures.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: Impedance data are subjected to deconvolution analysis and equivalent circuit fitting and approximate polarization resistances of the cathode and anode are determined.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: The results demonstrate that the utility of reference electrodes is limited and often wholly inappropriate.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes

Sentencas: Reported impedances and single electrode polarization values must be scrutinized on this basis.
Titulo: Analysis of SOFCs Using Reference Electrodes
